intro: Halenia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed halenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
